page.title: 13Housing in Upottery
page.content: {Upottery and Rawridge}are the two main housing areas as most others are isolated farms and cottages. We surveyed the houses in the two villages to find the types of houses and the materials used. The oldest houses were made with {stone}or{cob}for the{walls}and {thatched}roofs.Sometimes houses have a new roof instead of the thatch or it is covered with corrugated metal sheets. Later{stone buildings}have {slate roofs}and some of these have been replaced with modern asbestos slates.Two houses had roofs made of {wooden shingles.}The{new houses}and {bungalows}of{block}with{slate}or{tile roofs are{detached or semi_detached mainly but there are{link}or{terraced houses near Upottery School.One new house is made of blocks with an outer layer of stone to blend with others.
